channel.title: Homes on Xuan LI - UCLA Math
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Xuan LI - UCLA Math

item.description: I'm a highly motivated PhD student at MultiPLES Lab, UCLA Department of Mathematics, advised by Prof. Chenfanfu Jiang. Before that, I was a PhD student at Sig Lab, the University of Pennsylvania, working in the same group. I received my M.S. degree from the Department of Computer Science, the State University of New York at Stony Brook, and my B.S. degree from the Department of Mathematical Sciences, Tsinghua University (China).

The pronunciation of my name is like “Shayne Lee” in English. I love modern origami art because of the mathematical theory behind the origami design (Tree Theory). I was the president of Tsinghua Origami Club in 2014-2015. I started self-studying fingerstyle Ukelele years ago. Itâ€™s my new hobby now. I love reading science books and articles. I interned at Global Science Magazines Co., Ltd. (Chinese edition of Scientific American) for my whole undergraduate years as a science translator and an intern team leader.
PhD Student Multi-Physics Lagrangian-Eulerian Simulations (MultiPLES) Laboratory Department of Mathematics University of California, Los Angeles
